meanings.definition: The maximum amount that something can contain or produce.
meanings.sent1: The cup's capacity was five ounces.
meanings.sent2: The stadium has a seating capacity of 50,000 people.
meanings.sent3: I never knew a backpack had such a large capacity for books!
meanings.sent4: Her heart had a capacity for love that knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The capacity of the dam was tested during the heavy rainfall.

meanings.definition: The ability or power to do, experience, or understand something.
meanings.sent1: His capacity for learning new languages was impressive.
meanings.sent2: Children have an amazing capacity for imagination.
meanings.sent3: I wish I had the capacity to eat unlimited amounts of ice cream!
meanings.sent4: Her capacity for forgiveness was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The capacity of the human mind to adapt is remarkable.

meanings.definition: The mental or physical ability to receive or hold something.
meanings.sent1: The suitcase had a limited capacity for clothes.
meanings.sent2: The pitcher's arm had reached its capacity for throwing.
meanings.sent3: My brain's capacity for remembering names is quite poor.
meanings.sent4: The ship's hull had a capacity for carrying heavy cargo.
meanings.sent5: The capacity of the refrigerator was not enough for all the groceries.
